Official Website: http://squidsoft.net
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Humanity has just emerged from the lowest point in its collective history, and
the closest it has been to extinction since the advent of agriculture. By the
year 2304, the Coalition of humans and their alien allies the Jinu has spread
across the stars, and thought themselves powerful. But the Outsiders, an alien
empire occupying vast reaches of Rimward space, proved them wrong. First contact
between the two allies was severed, and suddenly humanity was alone. Then the
Outsiders attacked in force, and human planets and governments fell one by one.
                         It was the apocalypse.
But contrary to the beliefs of many, not all hope was lost. After five years,
a single starship, the Percival Lowell, returned from Rimward space, bringing
with it the means to nullify the Outsiders' greatest weapon. With this, and the
help of many other brave pilots, the occupying Outsiders were driven off human
               worlds and back to where they came from.
 Humanity is now trying to rebuild, and trying to regain what it has lost. The
Outsiders are finished with occupation, and now desire only to see humans
extinct.
New threats and new mysteries seem to appear every day. In the midst of it all,
civilian starships span the stars, maintaining an open threat against any new
       invasion and trying to make a few credits while they're at it.
You too have felt the lure of this; the desire for a unique freedom that most
citizens will never know, the drive to explore, the need to defend your species,
         and yes, greed for the vast wealth that is to be had.
                   It is time to take to the stars.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Welcome to the original and still the most innovative pulp science fiction
multiplayer roleplaying adventure!
Originally opened in its classic form on 19 December 1998! Reopened in its new
iteration on 28 February 2009!
All original work (including setting, non-player characters, design, source
code, all related background material, and all text) located in this game or on
the Squidsoft.net website is copyright (c) Squidsoft.net 1998-2015. Unauthorised
reproduction prohibited.
Warning: Speech in this game is largely uncensored, and sensitive individuals
may find some other players offensive. The staff is ultimately not responsible
for the words and actions of the players.
The last server reset was at Tue Jul 18 12:11:18 2017 UTC
We're on Twitter! @StarConquest for server status notifications and out-of-game
contact!
No new announcements to display.

    * Welcome to Star Conquest! *
[Starship "William Dove"; Living Quarters One]
This is a small room designed to give crew members a place to sleep while on
long journeys, and it isn't large enough to do much else. A long counter is
bolted to the wall opposite the entryway, and two narrow bunks have been bolted
to the two remaining walls. A small keypad is next to the door, controlling a
simple lock. The status lights overhead are currently not receiving power.
Looking through the windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a dusky pink rattan cabinet, a small red ball containing a realistic
Bari horde noisemaker, a glossy pale purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a large oval
dark purple and light purple cloth rug, a white four poster rattan bed with a
heart-shaped headboard and filmy deep purple hangings with a soft periwinkle
cashmere blanket, a set of lavender silk sheets, a large periwinkle bed pillow,
a hand-made purple and amethyst flower quilt, and a large periwinkle bed pillow
on it, and a small oval turquoise rattan table with a glass top here.
You can go out.
(You are lying on a white four poster rattan bed with a heart-shaped headboard
and filmy deep purple hangings with a soft periwinkle cashmere blanket, a set of
lavender silk sheets, a large periwinkle bed pillow, a hand-made purple and
amethyst flower quilt, and a large periwinkle bed pillow on it.)
stand
You stand up from a white four poster rattan bed with a heart-shaped headboard
and filmy deep purple hangings with a soft periwinkle cashmere blanket, a set of
lavender silk sheets, a large periwinkle bed pillow, a hand-made purple and
amethyst flower quilt, and a large periwinkle bed pillow on it.

trash bin, a high tech silver star print holovid, a black plastic tray of spider
chow, a compact white refrigerator, an insulated black cooler, Purr the humanoid
service robot, and a Tardick lizard named Asteria here.

couch.

Subject: Voting for Sixtieth Term Begins!
Author: AEU Pilot Liaison Office
Posted: 00:01 16 August 2317 GST
--
The time for announcing candidacy has ended! Here are the results.
As the only candidate, Dakhal Araegin will become the new Industrial Whip.
As the only candidate, Lily Kaise will become the new Ground Squad Leader.
As the only candidate, Constantine Stone will become the new Voice of the Corps.
As the only candidate, Shule Elemmire will become the new Space Defense Captain.
Barring any unforeseen difficulties, these results will stand at the start of
the next term.
The Office of the Civilian Pilot Corps Liaison

General Starship status:
HULL PLATING:                                     EAOS Plasma Resistant Plating
(225 damage absorption points) (modified to 100% by hull size and rated at 100%
of nominal) (Moderate resistance to minicannons)
REACTIONLESS DRIVE:                               EAOS Dual Reactionless Mk III
(Instantaneous velocity: 5333km/s, Maximum velocity: 24000 km/s, Acceleration
Rating: 25.0, Complete Deceleration in 5 seconds) (Running at 89% rated
efficiency and 0% rated maximum velocity)

Sensor (Hull Lockon Rate: 25% Wormhole Drive Lockon Rate: 50% Cloak Resolution
Distance: 1 unit)

II is operating at 30 damage per turret (100% of rated) and is operating at 91%
of rated efficiency (Hull Accuracy Added: 0% Time To Fire: 5s)

Compression (170% of standard)

Efficiency: 200% Combat Grid Usage: 110% Wormhole Drive Usage: 200% Max Engine
Speed: 5333km/s) (Maximum Charge: 100% of standard) (Drain Rate: n/a)

100% by hull size)

ftl new
Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that
bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.
New Earth rotates through space before you, a startingly verdant planet, colored
in greens and blues with pure white clouds.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to New Earth in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation
order is entered."
Via general sector communication, New Earth transmits, "Hello there, Firestorm!
Welcome to home space!"

read letter
--
Dear Mr. Elemmire,
Congratulations! We have decided to accept your application to purchase and
operate an AW-2 AEU Flare-class Twin-Assault Vessel!
The Alliance of Extrasolar Unions Board of Special Licenses had your application
reviewed by the finest psychologists, and we also reviewed all records of your
service as a pilot. At the conclusion of this process, it was decided that you
were well qualified to operate this equipment.
Thank you, and we hope you enjoy your new acquisition!
Sincerely,
The Alliance of Extrasolar Unions Board of Special Licenses

[The Torus; Dock Beta]
The pale gray walls, floor, and ceiling of this massive EAOS docking bay glow
with a pale white light. Though the bay remains open to space, it somehow also
retains its atmosphere. Outside, against the starry expanse of space, you can
see the bright glint of a solitary blue-white star. A sign indicates that the
main concourse is to the west, and the doorway to a rare starship supply store
is to the south, but it has been closed and securely locked.
The two-person flare "Deadly Strike" is landed here.

ftl drydock
A lone outpost glitters in an otherwise nondescript cloud of debris.
You stumble, then fall heavily to the floor.
(3 seconds roundtime.)
The League's legendary shipyards hang motionless in the dark here. Once, the
stations would be all but glowing with waste heat as the Intersector
Shipbuilding Company rolled out ship after ship. Now the stations are still and
darkened, and the ISC is no more.
A large frame hangs in space here, sufficiently large to at least contain a
battlecruiser-class starship.

bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.

l
[Starship "Deadly Strike"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a decoy beacon launcher, a wormhole drive tracer, and a dark green
leather captain's chair here.
You can go east, southeast, and out.

help civilian
--
Star Conquest Help: Civilian Liaisons
--
Category: Game Systems
--
Civilian liaisons are pilots in your alliance, just like you, who have the added
ability to act as go-betweens between the pilot corps and your alliance
government. These serve for one term lasting six weeks, and then the positions
are up for nomination and voting once again.
The actual positions differ among the alliances, but they all have the same
basic four functions.
* Voice - The Voice has the power to speak directly with the alliance
government. He or she can also manage voting by the pilot corps.
* Space Defense - The person in charge of space defense is able to monitor the
alliance's sectors and send information directly to alliance ships.
* Ground Squad - The person in charge of ground-based combat can view
information about the alliance's ground readiness and monitor ground actions in
progress.
* Industrial Whip - The industrial whip is able to monitor the corps' progress
toward achieving its performance goals or winning Conquest.
Civilian Liaisons
AEU
* Voice of the Corps:                    Vernos Bailey                          
  0010-16336
* Space Defense Captain:                 Constantine Stone                      
  0010-89705
Fringe
* Voice of the Fleet:                    Rogue Romano                           
  0100-04535
* Space Defense Captain:                 Gonzales Bourne                        
  0100-25477
* Industrial Whip:                       Nathaniel Owens                        
  0100-15597
* Ground Squad Leader:                   Alko Delovega                          
  0100-08779
League
* Voice of the League:                   Nicolette Lawrence                     
  0001-66298
* Space Defense Captain:                 Ali Candan                             
  0001-99451
* Ground Squad Leader:                   Joel Kringle                           
  0001-96047
Mutuality
* Progress Observation Comrade:          Cheri Lindbergh                        
  0000-77875
* People's Defense Commissar:            Aisling                                
  0000-73097
In addition, there is a counterpart liaison within the alliance government. This
person is a government official who is in charge of issues relating to the
civilian pilot corps. Note that, as a regular civilian pilot, you should
generally not contact these people directly -- that is the job of your Voice.
But if there is a pressing need to go over the head of your Voice, or if, as
Voice, you wish to communicate privately for some reason, you may wish to write
a letter to your official government liaison directly.
Government Liaisons
AEU
* Andrew Lambeth
Fringe
* Space Commodore Tashiro Yuki
* Sector Captain Conrad Hart
League
* Tobermory Wellington
Mutuality
* Aleksei Frolov
* Cassandra of Turanova
* Other relevant station controllers
EAOS
* Professor Sonorous Griswold
Special Term Actions
Regular nominations and voting both occur automatically. However, there are
other actions that may occur during a term. These actions are not based in coded
mechanics, but rather must be roleplayed appropriately with your Voice or a
government liaison.
Non-binding resolutions: The most common special action. Non-binding
resolutions, or proposals, can be initiated by the Voice at any time using the
voting machine in your liaison office's conference room. All active pilots are
free to vote however they wish on this proposal. The Voice may then communicate
the results to the government. However, the government is not obligated to take
any action that it does not consider appropriate no matter how many pilots
support it; hence "non-binding."
Recall elections: A recall election occurs when an elected office-holder has
performed unsatisfactorily and a vote is held to determine whether to remove him
or her from office before the term has ended. Most properly, more than one pilot
should petition the Voice to initiate such a proposal before it occurs. After an
appropriate time, the proposal can be ended and the results should be
communicated to the government. If the pilots are in favor of a recall and the
government considers their reasoning valid, the office-holder in question will
be removed. Pilots may also initiate such an action against their Voice, if the
situation calls for it, by petitioning their liaison within the government.
Resignations: An office-holder may communicate to their government, either
through the Voice or directly, that they cannot complete their term and wish to
resign. Usually such a resignation will be accepted within a day or two, leaving
the position vacant. This action should not be taken lightly, and all players
should seek to complete their terms. It is a responsibility both ICly and OOCly.
Special election: A special election occurs when a position is vacant in the
middle of a term (for instance, after a resignation or a recall election) and
must be filled. The Voice should allow at least 24 hours to take nominations and
should then list all interested candidates in a single proposal. At the end of
the vote, the results must be communicated to the government and the position
will be filled. Note that this is the only valid way to fill a vacant position;
an office-holder cannot, for example, resign their position and name someone
else to fill it.
Negotiations: Voices are authorized to call meetings with representatives from
other pilot corps and negotiate for new treaties or other changes in relations.
A Voice should communicate openly with his or her government and their own pilot
corps throughout this process, and verify via voting that their actions have the
corps' approval at every step in the process. A final non-binding resolution
must occur to verify the final terms of the agreement. If the government
approves the agreement, official documents will be provided for all parties to
sign in a final meeting. Note that all treaties must be justified by good
roleplaying and must fit current plotlines; buddies in different alliances often
want to make their respective corps exchange technology and such, but unless
their alliances have a lengthy history of good relations, the governments are
unlikely to consider such an exchange. Behind the scenes, theme, current
plotlines, and game balance are all taken into consideration when players are
seeking new treaties.
Declaration of war: A corps may unilaterally declare war against another pilot
corps. While this does not usually pit the alliances themselves against each
other, it will greatly escalate tensions. There should be a good reason to
consider such an action, or the government will be questioning the Voice rather
strenuously. Otherwise, the usual rules about non-binding resolutions apply.
In all corps actions, all pilots should be invited to gather to discuss the new
proposal. Witnesses should also be invited when the Voice determines the results
of a proposal. The date and time of any important meeting should be communicated
to the government in case the government liaison wishes to attend.
Note, finally, that all office-holders are under particular scrutiny, both by
their government and the media, and unwise remarks or actions can result in
controversy.
The Current Term
A civilian liaison term lasts for six weeks.
The current civilian term started on 10 July 2317 GST. Time remaining: 1 day, 1
hour, 58 minutes, and 9 seconds

[Starship "Deadly Strike"; Weapons Room]
Unlike the control room, a starship's weapon room has only one tiny viewport.
The focus of the room is a slightly miniaturized starmap, augmented with
additional spatial relationship information and various status displays. A
streamlined control board sits before the starmap, with prominent indicators for
lock status and weapon readiness. Control boards for the ship's weaponry are off
to either side, to be pulled into place at a moment's notice. The status lights
overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the windows, you see
that the ship is in a garage.
You see a swiveling dark green leather gunner's chair and an improved temporary
wormhole drive here.

[The Torus; Dock Beta]
The pale gray walls, floor, and ceiling of this massive EAOS docking bay glow
with a pale white light. Though the bay remains open to space, it somehow also
retains its atmosphere. Outside, against the starry expanse of space, you can
see the bright glint of a solitary blue-white star. A sign indicates that the
main concourse is to the west, and the doorway to a rare starship supply store
is to the south, but it has been closed and securely locked.
The two-person flare "Deadly Strike" is landed here.

ARC
   Damages a single target.
   Module:     Plasma
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 6 seconds
PLASMA HAMMER
   Damages a single target with heavy, slow burst damage.
   Module:     Plasma
   Energy:     40                Time To Use: 12 seconds
WAVE
   Damages a group of targets.
   Module:     Plasma
   Energy:     40                Time To Use: 6 seconds
ERODE
   Covers a group of enemies with corroding plasma, reducing their armor.
   Module:     Plasma
   Energy:     30                Time To Use: 8 seconds
ENVELOP
   Surrounds a target with plasma.
   Module:     Plasma
   Energy:     40                Time To Use: 4 seconds
CASCADE
   Damages a group of targets.
   Module:     Plasma
   Energy:     70                Time To Use: 10 seconds
SPIKE
   A swift attack against a single target.
   Module:     Plasma
   Energy:     30                Time To Use: 3 seconds
BOLT
   Heavily damages a single target.
   Module:     Plasma
   Energy:     50                Time To Use: 6 seconds
BURST
   Heavily damages a group of targets.
   Module:     Plasma
   Energy:     100               Time To Use: 6 seconds
PULSE
   Stuns a single target.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 6 seconds
SCRAMBLE
   Increases the likelihood that an enemy will drop intact items.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 6 seconds
REVERB
   Damages a single target over time.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     30                Time To Use: 6 seconds
SONIC SLAM
   Interrupts a group of enemies with a large sonic burst.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 8 seconds
SONIC WAVE
   Decreases the accuracy of a group of enemies.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     25                Time To Use: 10 seconds
SHAKE OFF
   Makes an enemy slightly more disinclined to hit you.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 4 seconds
GROUP PULSE
   Stuns a group of targets.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     30                Time To Use: 8 seconds

structure. The interior of your battlesuit cushions most of the turbulence.

thud as it impacts a surface, then the walls are suddenly peeling back, freeing
you.

[The Torus; Dock Beta]
The pale gray walls, floor, and ceiling of this massive EAOS docking bay glow
with a pale white light. Though the bay remains open to space, it somehow also
retains its atmosphere. Outside, against the starry expanse of space, you can
see the bright glint of a solitary blue-white star. A sign indicates that the
main concourse is to the west, and the doorway to a rare starship supply store
is to the south, but it has been closed and securely locked.
The five-person pulsar "Critical Strike" is landed here.
You can go west.

l
[Starship "Star Of Destiny"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a wormhole drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a shiny
round deep amethyst table with a painted tablecloth in a vivid patchwork
pattern, a large oval dark purple and light purple cloth rug, and a rare black
EAOSian contoured couch here.

An AEU Pilot's Guide To Ships And Upgrades                                      
  Page 13
Two-person Combat ships:
Two-Person Combat Scout 30,000,000.00 (New Earth allied technologies)
AY-104 AEU COMBAT SCOUT
Requirements: 500 industry points       500 combat points
Model number: AY-104                    Designation: Combat Scout
Turret hardpoints: 7                    Launcher hardpoints: 0
Standard storage capacity: 4000         Standard battery hours: 8
Docking bay size required: 12.5
Class Modifications:
Damage vs. Small Ships: 110%            Hull Hit Chance by Small Ships: 95%
Max Cruising Speed: 110%
The combat scout is one of the best small combat ships for the AEU. It's very
well armed and offers good laser bonuses. It also adds the further benefit of an
extra hull failsafe over the regular two-person scout.
Two-Person Bolt Thrower 132,000,000.00 (Endymion Revo Technologies)
RDT-E2M5 REVO DEVELOPMENTAL TECHNOLOGIES BOLT THROWER
Class: Corvette
Requirements: 450 industry points       650 combat points
Model number: RDT-E2M5                  Designation: Bolt Thrower
Turret hardpoints: 5                    Launcher hardpoints: 0
Standard storage capacity: 24000        Standard battery hours: 10
Docking bay size required: 26
Class Modifications:
Damage vs. Small Ships: 120%            Hull Hit Chance by Small Ships: 95%
The Bolt Thrower is a corvette-class starship. This ship has weapons in both the
control room and the weapons room, and has the added advantage of a
pre-installed bolt cannon. Hence, the big price tag.
Two-Person Flare (approval required) (Aenea)
AW-2 AEU FLARE-CLASS TWIN-ASSAULT VESSEL
Class: Corvette
Requirements: 2000 industry points      2500 combat points
Model number: AW-2                      Designation: Flare
Turret hardpoints: 12                   Launcher hardpoints: 0
Standard storage capacity: 500          Standard battery hours: 10
Docking bay size required: 20
   Class Modifications:
Damage vs. Small Ships: 120%            Hull Hit Chance by Small Ships: 95%
This is a very nice new AEU combat vessel. It has six laser turrets in each room
(the control room and the weapon room) and a nice, 35% laser bonus. However, you
will have to fill out an application if you ever want to own one, then wait to
see whether or not you will get approved to own it. Approval or denial
notifications can take from a few days up to a couple weeks. You will be
notified by mail either way.

[The Torus; Dock Beta]
The pale gray walls, floor, and ceiling of this massive EAOS docking bay glow
with a pale white light. Though the bay remains open to space, it somehow also
retains its atmosphere. Outside, against the starry expanse of space, you can
see the bright glint of a solitary blue-white star. A sign indicates that the
main concourse is to the west, and the doorway to a rare starship supply store
is to the south, but it has been closed and securely locked.
The four-person light carrier "Star Of Destiny" is landed here.

[The Torus; Dock Alpha]
The pale gray walls, floor, and ceiling of this massive EAOS docking bay glow
with a pale white light. Though the bay remains open to space, it somehow also
retains its atmosphere. Outside, you can see the bright glint of a solitary
blue-white star. Signs indicate that the repair and rearm facility, the starship
supply store, and the main concourse are to the north.
The one-person cargo hauler "Raging Blast", the four-person light carrier "Star
Of Destiny", the two-person medium transport "Registered Merchant 930", and the
two-person combat scout "Bonzai Trout" are landed here.
You see an automatic teller machine here.
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident is standing here.

The Space Defense Captain for the new term will be: Shule Elemmire
The new term will begin in 24 hours. Good luck!

She appears to be 28 years old. She is about five feet and two inches tall and
has fair skin. Her body is thin with attractively curved hips and shapely
calves. She has slender shoulders and slightly larger than average breasts. Her
face is oval and pretty, with a delicate nose and understated chin. Her lips are
lovely and blush pink and occasionally part to reveal a set of pretty teeth.
Beneath a set of arched eyebrows, her eyes are blue-green and almond-shaped. Her
mid-back length, straight hair is pale honey blonde and swept up into a thick
fall of loose curls down her back. She has oval pink fingernails.
A small enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her left earlobe and a small
enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her right earlobe.

collar and a pair of mystic purple suede clogs. She is also wearing an orange
and white blessed prayer bracelet around her wrist, a slender bracelet of tiny
tinkling silver bells around her wrist, a neon purple wrist-mounted chronometer,

2
A pair of odd-colored stars, one green and one blue, mark this curious area of
space. The sensors are picking up odd bits of noise that the ship's computer
insists on trying to convert to audio. Once in a while, something that could
almost sound like a word emerges from a burst of static.
The computer reports that in-sector beacons are transmitting the following:
=CkUT_Q^y*Um@2Q?.iqJ3}k~PhF8KtTT_&(Us<!q
This area of space is within the green belt of the nearest star, but there are
no life-bearing planets here. Instead there is merely an odd cluster of space
stations of unknown origin.
The sensor noise is much worse here, with a constant dark, gutteral snarling
sound emanating from the ship's speakers. It almost sounds like a language, but
it's nothing you've ever heard before, and the ship's computer cannot pinpoint a
source.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to League Autonavigating Solar Weather Station in thirty seconds unless
aborted or another navigation order is entered."

[Starship "Bari Smasher!"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a wormhole drive tracer, a sheet of white paper, a bari hive, a small

[Starship "Bari Smasher!"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a wormhole drive tracer, a sheet of white paper, a big red soldier felo,
and a large red soldier felo here.
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident is standing here.
You can go down and out.

she tries to work with a nearby control panel.

[Starship "William Dove"; Living Quarters One]
This is a small room designed to give crew members a place to sleep while on
long journeys, and it isn't large enough to do much else. A long counter is
bolted to the wall opposite the entryway, and two narrow bunks have been bolted
to the two remaining walls. A small keypad is next to the door, controlling a
simple lock. The status lights overhead are currently not receiving power.
Looking through the windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a dusky pink rattan cabinet, a small red ball containing a realistic
Bari horde noisemaker, a glossy pale purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a large oval
dark purple and light purple cloth rug, a white four poster rattan bed with a
heart-shaped headboard and filmy deep purple hangings with a soft periwinkle
cashmere blanket, a set of lavender silk sheets, a large periwinkle bed pillow,
a hand-made purple and amethyst flower quilt, and a large periwinkle bed pillow
on it, and a small oval turquoise rattan table with a glass top here.
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident is dozing on a white four poster rattan bed.
You can go out.
(You are lying on a white four poster rattan bed with a heart-shaped headboard
and filmy deep purple hangings with a soft periwinkle cashmere blanket, a set of
lavender silk sheets, a large periwinkle bed pillow, a hand-made purple and
amethyst flower quilt, and a large periwinkle bed pillow on it.)

l
[Starship "Deadly Strike"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a decoy beacon launcher, a wormhole drive tracer, and a dark green
leather captain's chair here.
You can go east, southeast, and out.

l deadly
the two-person flare "Deadly Strike"
You see a corvette here.
"Deadly Strike" is written along its hull in blocky silver letters.
The designation "AW-2" is stamped in tiny letters near its landing struts.
This starship advertises its function with its form. It does not look
particularly flightworthy, with protruding turrets, communications equipment,
and a box-like protrusion in the rear where the reactionless drive and wormhole
drive reside. But, of course, it is not intended to fly through an atmosphere. A
small protrusion on the nose of the vessel is its main sensor relay. Only the
bottom appears smooth, and even that is marred by the extension of its landing
struts when not in flight.
The hull is clean and painted a deep green color with silver trim. Its laser
turrets are blackened and outlined in silver. Its landing struts are clean and
painted gunmetal grey.
It has a smooth dome and a geodesic radome on the forward end.

[General Communication] Erik Goodwin transmits, "I'll pass."

dare make that shirt."

l last felo
an old big red felo
This strange, six-legged creature is vaguely cat-like, though its head appears
almost vulpine. It is large in size, and covered in short, striped red fur,
possessing a short, sleek tail that slowly flicks back and forth. The felo's
short, thick legs each end in three-toed paws with average, curved white claws
visible. A grey, Bari nose sits below a pair of clear blue eyes with vertical
pupils. It appears to be somewhat unsteady on its paws.

ftl hyperion
A single star shines brightly in the dark here, the light strangely comforting.
The ship's sensors indicate that the star's spectrum is nearly identical to
Sol's.
Hyperion's famous Sea of Grass is immediately obvious upon gazing at the planet,
the rolling, meters-deep expanse of tall grasses obscuring the contours of the
surface.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to Hyperion in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation order
is entered."

[Ardsley; Cranston Road]
Along this new concrete road are many new businesses, most of those on the south
being warehouses and light industry. A new housing area is visible in the hills
beyond the old brick homes on the north side of the street.
You can go east and west.
e
[Ardsley; Cranston Road]
You can go east and west.
l
[Ardsley; Cranston Road]
On the north side of this street are old houses, some with big trees in the
front that shade the sidewalk, but on the south side is an eclectic combination
of established Ardsley businesses relocated from elsewhere in town, including
the Stationery Bazaar and the recently reopened Linens and Stuff. Over the
rooftops, past the edge of town to the south, you can see the rolling landscape
of farms and hills, though some of the once open acreage is now occupied by new
housing developments.
You can go east and west.
e
[Ardsley; Cranston Road]
You can go east and west.
l
[Ardsley; Cranston Road]
The buildings here are an interesting mix of pretty new shops, utilitarian
warehouses, and old homes predating the war. Beyond the buildings on the north
side of the street is a new housing area built on a hill. To the south, front
and center in a new cluster of businesses, is Sparkles, a toiletries store with
many sparkly items in the spotlessly clean display windows. Beyond the rooftops
of Sparkles and the other businesses there is Ardsley's landscape of farms and
rolling hills, though new building has recently encroached upon the open lands.
An old ice cream truck is parked here on the side of the street.
You can go east and west.

l
[Starship "Deadly Strike"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a decoy beacon launcher, a wormhole drive tracer, and a dark green
leather captain's chair here.
You can go east, southeast, and out.

among the AEU.

AH-12b AEU Soothsayer-class Cruiser Mark II.

AEU.
      He is also known for being very good at combat gunning and the owner of an
AH-12 AEU Soothsayer-class Cruiser.
   
   Kaito Zalmont has not very many starship combat points among the AEU.
      He is also known for being very good with invading ship kills, very good
at combat piloting, and the owner of an AR-7C AEU Pulsar-class Assault Gunship.
   
   Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident has the most starship combat points among the
AEU.
      She is also known for being the best at advanced engineering techniques,
the best with mission-related ship kills, very good at combat gunning, and the
owner of an ASS-E7 Allied Starships Modular Tactical Platform.
   
   Angelica Torres has a good amount of starship combat points among the AEU.
      She is also known for being the best with minor skirmish ship kills, the
best at defending salvage operations, and the owner of an AH-12 AEU
Soothsayer-class Cruiser.
   
   Rogue Ace Pilot Ather Jammoa has a good amount of starship combat points
among the AEU.
      He is also known for being the best at combat piloting, the best at damage
control, the best with invading ship kills, and the owner of an AH-12 AEU
Soothsayer-class Cruiser.

[Starship "Deadly Strike"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a decoy beacon launcher, a wormhole drive tracer, and a dark green
leather captain's chair here.
You can go east, southeast, and out.

[MTTS] atherj: I'm kind of confused regarding the latest changelog entry. What
exactly are we supposed to be reporting if we see it? A ground enemy no longer
trying to kill us?
[MTTS] usfolks: Basically a failed attempt at mice, they spawn, but don't shoot
you. Or probably similar.
[MTTS] atherj: Oh. Weird times.
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident laughs.
[MTTS] usfolks: That was the scenario that caused it.
[MTTS] atherj: Delightful, delightful! Now I know what to watch for. Thanks.
[MTTS] usfolks: No problem.

changelog
Recent Minor Changes:
-----
Arachnopals no longer transcend time and space, and now cannot move in
directions beyond our comprehension.
   Posted 3 days, 19 hours, 46 minutes, and 53 seconds ago
-----
At long last, the STANDINGS command now gives far greater detail than a simple
like or dislike! 
Please look forward to new additions to this system in the future.
   Posted 2 days, 12 hours, 20 minutes, and 27 seconds ago
-----
Battlesuit energy may now be checked through roundtime.
   Posted 1 day, 13 hours, 34 minutes, and 34 seconds ago
-----
Ships that are unable to salvage (fighters, certain transports, etc) can no
longer deploy atmospheric scoops. This was a bit of an oversight, and we deeply
apologize for any inconvenience that this may cause.
Atmospheric scoops on ships that can no longer do so, of course, be transferred
off.
   Posted 1 day, 5 hours, 5 minutes, and 17 seconds ago
-----
Implemented a fix for ground enemies who fail to react after a failed encounter
is regenerated. Be sure to send a support ticket if you notice this still
happening.
   Posted 19 hours, 6 minutes, and 44 seconds ago
-----

standings
Major
  * Tandem Pact are reserved with you.
  * Accord of Free Worlds are affable with you.
Criminal Organizations
  * Omega Pirate Cartel are reserved with you.
  * Lambda Pirate Cartel are reserved with you.
Unregistered
  * Rimward Unaffiliated are reserved with you.
  * Spinward Clans are aware of you.
  * Coreward Genships are wary of you.
Old Guard
  * AEU Rogue Navy are affable with you.
  * League Association of Retired Pilots are aware of you.
  * Elite Pilots of New Earth are affable with you.
Corporation
  * Unreality Programming consider you a good friend.
  * Vortex Industries are unfriendly with you.
  * Scientia are unfriendly with you.
  * United Freight d'Intsec are unfriendly with you.
  * Intersector Shipbuilding Corporation trust you.
Alien
  * Outsiders hate you.
  * Interstellar Federation of Species hate you.

l
[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white
trash bin, a high tech silver star print holovid, a black plastic tray of spider
chow, a compact white refrigerator, an insulated black cooler, and Purr the
humanoid service robot here.
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident is sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured
couch.
You can go south and out.
(You are sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white
and sapphire star quilt on it.)
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident squeezes you affectionately.

[Old Frontier Processor; Docking Bay]
The hydraulics for the airlocks lining the long side of this spacious docking
bay run quietly and efficiently, transporting each newly docked ship to an
individual berth outlined with square white lights above and below. The nearly
seamless walls and floor are constructed of light gray metal with signs and
hatchways accented in dark green. Though few people are about, it seems a very
well built and maintained station.
The two-person flare "Deadly Strike" is landed here.

Subject: Artifact Alpha 777 - Building Plan
Author: Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident
Posted: 16:51 20 August 2317 GST
--
Regarding how we'll proceed to maintain Artifact Alpha 777 the following is the
current plan --
1. We'll maintain a complement of the Modules which SEAS Contributes on 'SEAS
Spare Parts'
2. LIBS will designate where their parts will be available.
3. It's hard to get Nicolette to be consistent concerning where she loads the
Core and other Modules from her org so will probably move them to 'SEAS Spare
Parts' as they do pose quite a bit of clutter aboard 'Herding Cats'.
Since Artifact Alpha is comprised of eight stations If Seas is primarily
responsible for four of them, and Libs is primarily responsible for the other
four, it hopefully will be less confusing if we do the following.
LIBS will maintain the accelerators, Salvage processor, and watchtower
Seas will maintain the beacons, transmitter, and charger.
Please watch the Range Office and keep notes on when these Temporary Space
Stations will need to be renewed. Whenever circumstances prevent any of us from
being available to deploy the stations which we are responsible for, please
contact me or communicate with Evenia and/or Johann.
--

Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident
She appears to be 28 years old. She is about five feet and two inches tall and
has fair skin. Her body is thin with attractively curved hips and shapely
calves. She has slender shoulders and slightly larger than average breasts. Her
face is oval and pretty, with a delicate nose and understated chin. Her lips are
lovely and blush pink and occasionally part to reveal a set of pretty teeth.
Beneath a set of arched eyebrows, her eyes are blue-green and almond-shaped. Her
mid-back length, straight hair is pale honey blonde and swept up into a thick
fall of loose curls down her back. She has oval pink fingernails.
A small enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her left earlobe and a small
enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her right earlobe.
 She is wearing a stretchy long-sleeved purple top with a brightly colored
dragon print, a pair of white jeans, and a pair of white leather clogs with a
row of glittery fireflies across the toes. She is also wearing an orange and
white blessed prayer bracelet around her wrist, a slender bracelet of tiny
tinkling silver bells around her wrist, a neon purple wrist-mounted chronometer,
a solid silver ring engraved with dragonflies, a delicate ring of silver wire
and small purple amethyst crystals, a metallic gold touch einrophone in a
metallic purple reinforced plastic phone holster, an elegant white gold ring
inset with a perfect solitaire diamond, a light purple flightbag with a pastel
kitten on the side, and a soft fuchsia Tardick lizard snuggly labeled 'Asteria'.
Her head, face, both eyes, neck, both wrists, and both hands are left uncovered.
She is carrying a sheet of blue paper in her right hand.

You peer north...
[Old Frontier Processor; Docking Bay]
The hydraulics for the airlocks lining the long side of this spacious docking
bay run quietly and efficiently, transporting each newly docked ship to an
individual berth outlined with square white lights above and below. The nearly
seamless walls and floor are constructed of light gray metal with signs and
hatchways accented in dark green. Though few people are about, it seems a very
well built and maintained station.
The two-person flare "Deadly Strike" and the five-person A.S.S. tactical
platform "William Dove" are landed here.
You see an automatic teller machine here.
You can go north, northeast, south, northwest, and up.

l flare
I see no "flare" here.
l deadly
the two-person flare "Deadly Strike"
You see a corvette here.
"Deadly Strike" is written along its hull in blocky silver letters.
The designation "AW-2" is stamped in tiny letters near its landing struts.
This starship advertises its function with its form. It does not look
particularly flightworthy, with protruding turrets, communications equipment,
and a box-like protrusion in the rear where the reactionless drive and wormhole
drive reside. But, of course, it is not intended to fly through an atmosphere. A
small protrusion on the nose of the vessel is its main sensor relay. Only the
bottom appears smooth, and even that is marred by the extension of its landing
struts when not in flight.
The hull is clean and painted a deep green color with silver trim. Its laser
turrets are blackened and outlined in silver. Its landing struts are clean and
painted gunmetal grey.
It has an AEU logo forward on the port side and a smooth dome and a geodesic
radome on the forward end.

is now fully mapped and lined with beacons.

there, Deadly Strike! Welcome to home space!"

power

leaving you in a dim silence.
l
[Starship "Deadly Strike"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is at Old Frontier Processor; Docking Bay.
You see a decoy beacon launcher, a wormhole drive tracer, and a dark green
leather captain's chair here.
You can go east, southeast, and out.
[Notification from Space Explorers Amidst The Stars] An asteroid has been
received at League Asteroid Processing Nuclear Temporary Station from the
two-person hardened asteroid hauler "Flint". The organization has earned
375,712.56 credits.

power

from the various starship systems.
launch

launch. Good luck and come back to us safely."

ftl new
The ship is already moving.
ftl new
Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that
bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.
New Earth rotates through space before you, a startingly verdant planet, colored
in greens and blues with pure white clouds.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to New Earth in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation
order is entered."

transponder. You are cleared to land at the city of New Phoenix."

ftl frontier cluster
Once a valuable source for raw materials on the edge of Known Space, this area
is now fully mapped and lined with beacons.
Dark asteroids tumble lazily through the emptiness of space.
Via general sector communication, Old Frontier Processor transmits, "Hello
there, Deadly Strike! Welcome to home space!"

help aces
--
Star Conquest Help: Aces and Veterans
--
Category: Background
--
In Star Conquest, we have a few levels of pilots beyond your standard pilot.
* Ace pilots are well known by most, if not all pilots in the leagues, and their
actions have been recorded in the annals of history, such that anyone with a
vested interest in the pilot leagues would know of their deeds.
* Veteran pilots transcend the ace classification, in that they tend to be
'larger than life'. A veteran pilot tends to be well known in popular (non-pilot
and otherwise) culture, and more often than not have holovids detailing their
exploits.
Obtaining ace or veteran status is handled primarily ingame, through one's
character's actions, although in some cases it can also be obtained through a
special application in character generation.
The following is a listing of current and former (player character) pilots
holding ace or veteran status.
AEU:
* Ather Jammoa: Ace Pilot
    Status: ACTIVE
    Notable Awards: Phoenix Burst (Medal), Accord of Free Worlds Meritorious
Service Medal, Aria Star (Medal)
    Achievements: Defense of New Earth, Defense of United Stations of the Accord
* Sean Dillon: Retired Former Ace Pilot
    Status: INACTIVE
    Notable Awards: Velourian Star (Medal)
    Other Notes: Acedom removed due to mishandling of delicate diplomatic
situation.
League:
* Alfred Wecksly: Ace Pilot
    Status: ACTIVE
    Notable Awards: Silver Coalition Command Flying Cross
* Nissi Valdaire: Ace Pilot
    Status: ACTIVE
    Notable Awards: League Distinguished Flying Cross, Accord of Free Worlds
Meritorious Service Medal, Aria Star (Medal), Purple Heart (Medal)
Fringe:
* Cesar Ysidro: Ace Pilot
    Status: ACTIVE
    Notable Awards: Burlingame Siegebreaker (Medal)
    Achievements: Defense of Chetumal
    Other Notes: Participant in [CLASSIFIED] Experiment #009703: [CLASSIFIED].
* Darin Frost: Ace Pilot
    Status: INACTIVE
    Achievements: Blockade Runner/Smuggler
    Other Notes: Location unknown.
* Nick Enderton: Ace Pilot
    Status: INACTIVE
    Achievements: Defense of Chetumal
    Other Notes: Location unknown.
* Rowan McKell: Former Veteran Pilot
    Status: INACTIVE
    Achievements: Defense of Chetumal
    Other Notes: Demerited by Nina Thomas for repeatedly speaking ill of the
Confederation of Fringe Worlds.
* Scott Hawkins: Former Ace Pilot
    Status: ACTIVE
    Achievements: Defense of Chetumal
    Other Notes: Former member of the Fringe Navy. Acedom removed, reasons
unknown.
* Tabi Canis: Ace Pilot
    Status: ACTIVE
    Notable Awards: Accord of Free Worlds Meritorious Service Medal
    Achievements: [3 CLASSIFIED ENTRIES], Defense of Chetumal
    Other Notes: [CLASSIFIED]
* Tony Matos: Retired Veteran Pilot
    Status: INACTIVE
    Achievements: Defense of Chetumal
    Other Notes: Lost vision during the Battle of Chetumal, Participant in
Fringe Medical Experiment #001719: [CLASSIFIED]
Mutuality:
* Anfisa of Marzore: Veteran Pilot
    Status: ACTIVE
    Notable Awards: Accord of Free Worlds Meritorious Service Medal, Aria Star
    Achievements: Defense of Sector -1: Renegade Fleet Command Center
    Other Notes: Member of unreg subfactions: Renegade, Marzore Clan, Shade
Clan, Former name: Aradi.
* Dylan Sparks: Ace Pilot
    Status: ACTIVE
    Achievements: Defense of New Beginning
    Other Notes: Member of unreg subfaction: Renegade. Custom made. Location
known.

peer n
You peer north...
[Old Frontier Processor; Docking Bay]
The hydraulics for the airlocks lining the long side of this spacious docking
bay run quietly and efficiently, transporting each newly docked ship to an
individual berth outlined with square white lights above and below. The nearly
seamless walls and floor are constructed of light gray metal with signs and
hatchways accented in dark green. Though few people are about, it seems a very
well built and maintained station.
The two-person flare "Deadly Strike" is landed here.

peer lounge
You peer into a transparisteel doorway into the pilot lounge...
[New Earth; Pilot Lounge]
This roomy, circular lounge sits on the very lip of the landing pad outside,
with half of it suspended over the water below. Large transparisteel windows
overlook the ocean at one end and afford a great view of the landing pad at the
other, the material tinting itself automatically when needed. The walls, tables,
and floor are gleaming white lucite, kept immaculately clean by tiny drones that
zip around with automated efficiency. A row of couches face toward the windows,
leaving a relatively open section in the middle of the room. The news broadcast
flickers across the surface of each sleek white table to keep the pilots
informed of the latest goings-on. A stairway towards the back of the room has
its door open and bears a sign reading 'Garage'.
You see a semi-circular bar, a public holovid, a brightly-lit candy vending
machine, and a shiny chrome trash bin here.
Tara Flores is standing here.
You can go out.
go lounge
[New Earth; Pilot Lounge]

machine, and a shiny chrome trash bin here.
Tara Flores is standing here.
You can go out.

-tara How's it going?

l tara
Tara Flores
She appears to be 22 years old. She is about five feet and three inches tall and
has fair skin. Her body is full-figured with pleasantly rounded hips and shapely
calves. She has slender shoulders and average-sized breasts. Her face is round
and girlish, with a button nose and sharp chin. Her lips are soft and rosy and
occasionally part to reveal a set of white teeth. Beneath a set of thin
eyebrows, her eyes are green and round. Her shoulder-length, wispy hair is pale
honey blonde and hanging in a smooth fall with short, wispy bangs. She has a
past injury on her right cheek.
 She is wearing a navy blue flight jacket, a navy blue flightsuit, a pair of
dark brown gunnery gloves, a black utility belt, and a pair of dark blue leather
boots. She is also wearing a keychain, a metachannel FTL communicator and watch,
a navy blue canvas gear bag, a silver-toned engineering tool case, a plain touch
einrophone in a dark gray leather phone holster, and a bulky asteroid supply
cannon. Her head, face, both eyes, and neck are left uncovered.
She is carrying a piping hot turnover filled with cheese steak in her right
hand.
Tara waves to you "Its going good, just taking a break. Hauled in ten asteroids
today."
Tara Flores sits down on a slim and fashionable couch.
Tara Flores takes a bite of a piping hot turnover filled with cheese steak.
grin tara 'Nice!
"Nice!" You grin at Tara Flores.

[New Earth; Pilot Lounge]
This roomy, circular lounge sits on the very lip of the landing pad outside,
with half of it suspended over the water below. Large transparisteel windows
overlook the ocean at one end and afford a great view of the landing pad at the
other, the material tinting itself automatically when needed. The walls, tables,
and floor are gleaming white lucite, kept immaculately clean by tiny drones that
zip around with automated efficiency. A row of couches face toward the windows,
leaving a relatively open section in the middle of the room. The news broadcast
flickers across the surface of each sleek white table to keep the pilots
informed of the latest goings-on. A stairway towards the back of the room has
its door open and bears a sign reading 'Garage'.
You see a semi-circular bar, a public holovid, a brightly-lit candy vending
machine, and a shiny chrome trash bin here.
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident is sitting on a slim and fashionable couch.
Patriot Dakhal Araegin, Tara Flores, Morris Corlew, Melinda Michaels, Tobias
Hawthorne, and Nissi Valdaire are standing here.
You can go out.
The volume of conversation rises briefly on the other side of the room.

drones like im some sort a drone army commander."

Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that
bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.
New Earth rotates through space before you, a startingly verdant planet, colored
in greens and blues with pure white clouds.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to New Earth in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation
order is entered."

\l
[New Earth; Pilot Lounge]
This roomy, circular lounge sits on the very lip of the landing pad outside,
with half of it suspended over the water below. Large transparisteel windows
overlook the ocean at one end and afford a great view of the landing pad at the
other, the material tinting itself automatically when needed. The walls, tables,
and floor are gleaming white lucite, kept immaculately clean by tiny drones that
zip around with automated efficiency. A row of couches face toward the windows,
leaving a relatively open section in the middle of the room. The news broadcast
flickers across the surface of each sleek white table to keep the pilots
informed of the latest goings-on. A stairway towards the back of the room has
its door open and bears a sign reading 'Garage'.
You see a semi-circular bar, a public holovid, a brightly-lit candy vending
machine, and a shiny chrome trash bin here.
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident and Nissi Valdaire are sitting on a slim and
fashionable couch. Tobias Hawthorne is standing here.
You can go out.
[General Communication] Morris Corlew transmits, "I'm tryin not to nod off."
The volume of conversation rises briefly on the other side of the room.
Tobias rubs his temple.
[General Communication] Melinda Michaels transmits, "Oh no, the xeno station is
about to fall."
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident says, "Wow they sure can get loud over there."
[General Communication] Morris Corlew transmits, "Aww."
Tobias Hawthorne says, "Time for some rest myself. Later."

[New Earth; Pilot Corps Liaison Office; Space Defense Captain]
This office is small but elegant, the recessed lighting shining softly over pale
green carpet, silvery white walls, and a modestly sized modern steel desk with
an ergonomically designed mesh and leather chair behind it. Arranged in front of
the desk are several other chairs, while ferns in white pots occupy the corners
of the office, and on the walls are framed images of sleek AEU starships. The
door is closed.
You see the Space Defense Captain terminal and a large metal filing cabinet
here.

help civilian
--
Star Conquest Help: Civilian Liaisons
--
Category: Game Systems
--
Civilian liaisons are pilots in your alliance, just like you, who have the added
ability to act as go-betweens between the pilot corps and your alliance
government. These serve for one term lasting six weeks, and then the positions
are up for nomination and voting once again.
The actual positions differ among the alliances, but they all have the same
basic four functions.
* Voice - The Voice has the power to speak directly with the alliance
government. He or she can also manage voting by the pilot corps.
* Space Defense - The person in charge of space defense is able to monitor the
alliance's sectors and send information directly to alliance ships.
* Ground Squad - The person in charge of ground-based combat can view
information about the alliance's ground readiness and monitor ground actions in
progress.
* Industrial Whip - The industrial whip is able to monitor the corps' progress
toward achieving its performance goals or winning Conquest.
Civilian Liaisons
AEU
* Voice of the Corps:                    Vernos Bailey                          
  0010-16336
* Space Defense Captain:                 Constantine Stone                      
  0010-89705
Fringe
* Voice of the Fleet:                    Rogue Romano                           
  0100-04535
* Space Defense Captain:                 Gonzales Bourne                        
  0100-25477
* Industrial Whip:                       Nathaniel Owens                        
  0100-15597
* Ground Squad Leader:                   Alko Delovega                          
  0100-08779
League
* Voice of the League:                   Nicolette Lawrence                     
  0001-66298
* Space Defense Captain:                 Ali Candan                             
  0001-99451
* Ground Squad Leader:                   Joel Kringle                           
  0001-96047
Mutuality
* Progress Observation Comrade:          Cheri Lindbergh                        
  0000-77875
* People's Defense Commissar:            Aisling                                
  0000-73097
In addition, there is a counterpart liaison within the alliance government. This
person is a government official who is in charge of issues relating to the
civilian pilot corps. Note that, as a regular civilian pilot, you should
generally not contact these people directly -- that is the job of your Voice.
But if there is a pressing need to go over the head of your Voice, or if, as
Voice, you wish to communicate privately for some reason, you may wish to write
a letter to your official government liaison directly.
Government Liaisons
AEU
* Andrew Lambeth
Fringe
* Space Commodore Tashiro Yuki
* Sector Captain Conrad Hart
League
* Tobermory Wellington
Mutuality
* Aleksei Frolov
* Cassandra of Turanova
* Other relevant station controllers
EAOS
* Professor Sonorous Griswold
Special Term Actions
Regular nominations and voting both occur automatically. However, there are
other actions that may occur during a term. These actions are not based in coded
mechanics, but rather must be roleplayed appropriately with your Voice or a
government liaison.
Non-binding resolutions: The most common special action. Non-binding
resolutions, or proposals, can be initiated by the Voice at any time using the
voting machine in your liaison office's conference room. All active pilots are
free to vote however they wish on this proposal. The Voice may then communicate
the results to the government. However, the government is not obligated to take
any action that it does not consider appropriate no matter how many pilots
support it; hence "non-binding."
Recall elections: A recall election occurs when an elected office-holder has
performed unsatisfactorily and a vote is held to determine whether to remove him
or her from office before the term has ended. Most properly, more than one pilot
should petition the Voice to initiate such a proposal before it occurs. After an
appropriate time, the proposal can be ended and the results should be
communicated to the government. If the pilots are in favor of a recall and the
government considers their reasoning valid, the office-holder in question will
be removed. Pilots may also initiate such an action against their Voice, if the
situation calls for it, by petitioning their liaison within the government.
Resignations: An office-holder may communicate to their government, either
through the Voice or directly, that they cannot complete their term and wish to
resign. Usually such a resignation will be accepted within a day or two, leaving
the position vacant. This action should not be taken lightly, and all players
should seek to complete their terms. It is a responsibility both ICly and OOCly.
Special election: A special election occurs when a position is vacant in the
middle of a term (for instance, after a resignation or a recall election) and
must be filled. The Voice should allow at least 24 hours to take nominations and
should then list all interested candidates in a single proposal. At the end of
the vote, the results must be communicated to the government and the position
will be filled. Note that this is the only valid way to fill a vacant position;
an office-holder cannot, for example, resign their position and name someone
else to fill it.
Negotiations: Voices are authorized to call meetings with representatives from
other pilot corps and negotiate for new treaties or other changes in relations.
A Voice should communicate openly with his or her government and their own pilot
corps throughout this process, and verify via voting that their actions have the
corps' approval at every step in the process. A final non-binding resolution
must occur to verify the final terms of the agreement. If the government
approves the agreement, official documents will be provided for all parties to
sign in a final meeting. Note that all treaties must be justified by good
roleplaying and must fit current plotlines; buddies in different alliances often
want to make their respective corps exchange technology and such, but unless
their alliances have a lengthy history of good relations, the governments are
unlikely to consider such an exchange. Behind the scenes, theme, current
plotlines, and game balance are all taken into consideration when players are
seeking new treaties.
Declaration of war: A corps may unilaterally declare war against another pilot
corps. While this does not usually pit the alliances themselves against each
other, it will greatly escalate tensions. There should be a good reason to
consider such an action, or the government will be questioning the Voice rather
strenuously. Otherwise, the usual rules about non-binding resolutions apply.
In all corps actions, all pilots should be invited to gather to discuss the new
proposal. Witnesses should also be invited when the Voice determines the results
of a proposal. The date and time of any important meeting should be communicated
to the government in case the government liaison wishes to attend.
Note, finally, that all office-holders are under particular scrutiny, both by
their government and the media, and unwise remarks or actions can result in
controversy.
The Current Term
A civilian liaison term lasts for six weeks.
The current civilian term started on 10 July 2317 GST. Time remaining: 1 minute
and 21 seconds
--

l
[New Earth; Pilot Corps Liaison Office; Space Defense Captain]
This office is small but elegant, the recessed lighting shining softly over pale
green carpet, silvery white walls, and a modestly sized modern steel desk with
an ergonomically designed mesh and leather chair behind it. Arranged in front of
the desk are several other chairs, while ferns in white pots occupy the corners
of the office, and on the walls are framed images of sleek AEU starships. The
door is open.

here.

What notice would you like to send to all AEU communicators?
Greetings AEU! My name is Shule and I am your new Space Defense Captain. A
couple of reminders. Please keep your ships powered down on landing pads and
garaged where possible to help prevent bari infestations. If you find your ship
is infested, do not land and say something over the alliance channel or tactical
channel. Second, please tune your communicators to the alliance tuner or 0 and
monitor channel 4. If you do hear of a sector going on alert, please say
something over the alliance channel or over tactical. Third, if you would like
assistance in learning any aspect of space combat: gunning, flying, or
engineering, please don't hesitate to get in touch with me. Letters addressed to
Shule will find me or you can reach me on comms or by calling the Space Defense
Captain's office at 0010-89705. Take care and fly safe.

You can go north, east, south, west, and up.
w
[New Earth; Spaceport West]
You can go east, south, and west.
d
You can't go that way.
w
[New Earth; Spaceport West]
You see a sanitation drone here.
You can go north, northeast, east, southeast, south, southwest, west, northwest,
up, and down.
d
[New Earth; Basement]
You can go northeast, east, southeast, south, southwest, northwest, and up.
se
[New Earth; Alliance of Extrasolar Unions Ship Licensing]
You see a large silver-framed notice here.
You can go northwest.
nw
[New Earth; Basement]
sw
You can go northeast, east, southeast, south, southwest, northwest, and up.
[New Earth; Starship Registry]
You can go northeast.
lsit
I don't understand that.

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white
trash bin, a high tech silver star print holovid, a black plastic tray of spider
chow, a compact white refrigerator, an insulated black cooler, and Purr the
humanoid service robot here.
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident is sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured
couch.
You can go south and out.

sapphire star quilt on it.

again. I just hoped he was telling the truth."

wrap lily

sit couch

Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident wraps her arms around you, pulling you close.

anything he says."
'I know.

'that's why I said I hoped he was telling the truth.

laugh

Kaise, Phoenix Dissident's shoulder.
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident nods.
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident says, "Well as I say he's history now."
nod

likely fear his surroundings for as long as he maintains his license."

l
[Telex-Providence Spaceport; Metro Rail Station]
Though encroached upon by gigantic flora from all sides, this railway platform
is fully functional and shinily modern. Gleaming tracks lead away to the west,
weaving through towering trees toward the City of Providence--though you can't
see it from here thanks to the oppressive foliage. Digital readouts discreetly
placed above the platform provide arrival and departure times, updated by the
minute. Through an automatic sliding door to the north, you can see the bustle
of the spaceport's central hall. A prominently placed sign indicates that this
stop on the metro rail circuit is currently closed for maintenance.
You can go north.

This is a small room designed to give crew members a place to sleep while on
long journeys, and it isn't large enough to do much else. A long counter is
bolted to the wall opposite the entryway, and two narrow bunks have been bolted

simple lock. The status lights overhead are currently not receiving power.

[Starship "William Dove"; Living Quarters One]
This is a small room designed to give crew members a place to sleep while on
long journeys, and it isn't large enough to do much else. A long counter is
bolted to the wall opposite the entryway, and two narrow bunks have been bolted
to the two remaining walls. A small keypad is next to the door, controlling a
simple lock. The status lights overhead are currently not receiving power.
Looking through the windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a dusky pink rattan cabinet, a small red ball containing a realistic
Bari horde noisemaker, a glossy pale purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a large oval
dark purple and light purple cloth rug, a white four poster rattan bed with a

a hand-made purple and amethyst flower quilt, and a large periwinkle bed pillow
on it, a small oval turquoise rattan table with a glass top, and a Tardick

[Notification from Space Explorers Amidst The Stars] The organization has
received 404,718.88 EAOS credits from a toll payment to League Rift Accelerating
Battery-Powered Toll Station in Home Beacon Gamma 001.
Minor Change:
The minimum payment for a fine is now one million credits or one fifth of the
fine amount, whichever is smaller.
This will have the effect of reducing the financial strain on people with
moderate to severe fines, as previously it was simply one fifth of the fine
amount, regardless of how large the fine was. In certain instances this means
the minimum payment would reach into the tens of millions or higher.
[Notification from Space Explorers Amidst The Stars] The organization has
contributed to a new League Rift Accelerating Battery-Powered Temporary Station
in Artifact Beacon Alpha 777.

[Starship "William Dove"; Observation Deck]
You see a large round light purple and dark purple cloth rug, an antique oak
table from Old Earth, a textured plasteel floor lamp with a cream shade (casting
a white-colored glow), a violet leather sectional sofa, a glossy lilac ceramic
felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling coral pink-lit aquarium containing white
and light blue aquatic life and coral rocks, and a black plastic tray of spider
chow here.
You can go north, east, south, west, up, and down.
smell me
You sniff at yourself. You smell the fresh fragrance of a sun-warmed grassy
meadow.
get suit
You remove a small suitcase from a leather briefcase.
open suit
A small suitcase is already open.
get briefs from suit
You remove a pair of white cotton briefs from a small suitcase.
wear briefs

What was once a feature of interstellar geography is now the name of an
alliance, and the heart of Fringe space can be found past this gateway. The tiny
station of Nuevo Laredo stands guard here.
The planet of Chetumal floats before you here, the richest planet among the
Fringe Worlds, although that isn't saying a lot.

proceed to Chetumal in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation order
is entered."

A pair of odd-colored stars, one green and one blue, mark this curious area of
space. The sensors are picking up odd bits of noise that the ship's computer
insists on trying to convert to audio. Once in a while, something that could
almost sound like a word emerges from a burst of static.
The computer reports that in-sector beacons are transmitting the following:
exh4i_6t6b)1}lc~?T4u]11{.${WbO^%.]E7J$2?
This area of space is within the green belt of the nearest star, but there are
no life-bearing planets here. Instead there is merely an odd cluster of space
stations of unknown origin.
The sensor noise is much worse here, with a constant dark, gutteral snarling
sound emanating from the ship's speakers. It almost sounds like a language, but
it's nothing you've ever heard before, and the ship's computer cannot pinpoint a
source.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to League Salvage Processing Nuclear Autonav Station in thirty seconds
unless aborted or another navigation order is entered."
Via general sector communication, League Autonavigating Solar Weather Station
transmits, "Current riftflow conditions are 2482 light-minutes per second from
Galactic West and Very Slightly Down."
Via general sector communication, Beacon E-02 transmits in a robotic voice,
"Detecting vessel 'Deadly Strike.' Welcome to The Belt of Orion."

ftl accord
A handful of lonely beacons watch over this area of space, their lights glowing
palely in the dark, surrounded by tendrils of drifting dust and debris.
A planet once existed here, until it was destroyed by the Outsiders. Now only
large chunks of the planet remain, still drifting slowly away from each other,
with clouds of debris filling the sector.
A circular space station dominates this sector, made of darkened metal
reinforced against attack. By the look of it, this is probably the most heavily
armored station in human space, excepting The Torus. This is the heart of the
Accord of Free Worlds.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to AFW Command (Dock One) in thirty seconds unless aborted or another
navigation order is entered."
ships

enter
